Posts.Content: I read a lot online about "self prostate massage". I know these are dangerous for prostate cancer and for infections, as they could cause the cancer or infection to spread. I asked my urologist and he says that back in the old days doctors did perform massages on patients, but they are no longer used or considered more beneficial than today's drugs. But, has any one every tried these otherwise, and found them to be of any benefit?
Posts.Title: Self prostate massage really benificial?

Posts.Content: My desire is not to "evaluate", but rather my question is more to find out "does massage really help"? Has anyone ever tried this and found that it is really beneficial as far as 1) clearing the prostate duct 2) helping to relieve inflammation?, etc.
Posts.Title: Self prostate massage really benificial?

Posts.Content: I had a 1.16 PSA back in March 2016. In October 2016, it had gone up to 4.76. I am now scheduled for a follow up PSA and exam in a couple of weeks. If the PSA is still high I will need to undergo a biopsy. I am 56. Has anyone my age undergone a biopsy? How much pain? (I underwent a circumcision due to frequent Balanitis couple of years ago with only local anesthetic, I still felt some pain, but it was bearable). What can I do to prepare? Could anyone let me know what to expect? With all good wishes and thanks!
Posts.Title: prostate biopsy due to sudden elevated PSA

Could anyone let me know what to expect? With all good wishes and thanks!
Posts.Title: prostate biopsy due to sudden elevated PSA

Posts.Content: Hello, thanks for the info. I see a Urologist once a year. It was my regular routine lab work with my regular GP who orders a PSA as part of his routine exam, when the reading came back high, he told me to go back to the Urologist. This is when the Urologist did another DRE and told me to return for a follow up PSA/DRE. If the PSA is still high then we will do the biopsy. I do have inflammation and am on Carduran 2mg and Cialis 5gm which has taken care of urine flow. The DRE was fine with no abnormalities.
Posts.Title: prostate biopsy due to sudden elevated PSA

Posts.Content: Thanks HighlanderCFH: With reference to exerciser, I walk about 13500 steps/2 hours per day. Does this count as the strenuous excessive you mentioned? Yet, I have done this walking for years, thru several other PSA's which were not affected. I hope my sudden elevated might be just because there was an infection. I just don't want do anything to contribute to a false high. Thanks!
